column4: apt-get upgrade doesn't pull in kernels (and some other stuff) for that you need  apt-get dist-upgrade
i would examine your motives, what you are trying to accomplish, and ask if upgrading to 64-bit ubuntu would serve any reasonable purpose. (if you are just doing it for kicks, then fine)
so you have more memory on your system than 32-bit ubuntu can utilize?
i'm not sure what the complaints against the pae kernel are, but pae kernel should be an easy transistion. I recommend trying that first.
